website_summaries.verdict: This hang-on allows you to fit your stand in a tree with a lot of branches, or a tree that has not grown straight.
pros: Adjustable seat allows you to easily level your platform both up and down or left and right
Good for public land where you cannot cut branches
cons: The seat does not have a back and is not generally as comfortable as some others on the market

customer_reviews.title: portable and comfortable with a few adjustments
customer_reviews.text: Great stand! Feels sturdy in the tree, light weight to carry through the woods. I would attached my old military rucksack frame with zip ties and makes this much easier to carry through the woods. You can find the frame for sale on amazon for around $20. My hunting friend bought one after he seen my setup. You can also buy these straps for a rucksack or sacrifice an old backpack.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Recommend you tube mods after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Magically Lightweight. Clearly filled with helium and forged by elves from Rivendale middle earth. One stand to rule them all. Just enough sq ft to be effective light and mobile. Recommend viewing youtube mods after purchase
customer_reviews.author: Armageddon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stand
customer_reviews.text: High quality stand, works great. It's a little pricey though. I'll try to be critical about a couple of things. I wonder why they ship a thin cushion and sell a thick cushion as an upgrade. At $250 a stand, the thick cushion should be an option in the base price. Another critique, seems like everyone online tries to wrap the front of the deck to help deaden noise. They could ship it with a solution for that.
customer_reviews.author: 9a7ner

customer_reviews.title: Buy it NOW~!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't worked with a hang on stand, practice practice practice before you go into the woods. I only used the pine in my yard. Practice on a few different trees. This stand awesome and easy to use with practice. I still have a little trouble getting the cleat by the seat to dig firmly into the tree on the first attempt, but it is too easy to re-adjust. You will need to add cord or rubber to the platform. This is my only complaint. Nothing is perfect. The seat makes noise on the platform when collapsed and you are backpacking it into the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and solid
customer_reviews.text: Got it on Wednesday . I’m in it right now and am loving it . Light, rock solid platform . Out of the box it looked like it had been roughed up but i don’t care because it works as advertised . Seat could be a lot thicker . I don’t hold that against the stand because I knew that by reading reviews and my new Comfort seat was delivered 3 hours ago . I will have that on for tomorrow’s hunt .
customer_reviews.author: ramjet63

customer_reviews.title: Super light and deadly silent for running and gunning on ...
customer_reviews.text: Super light and deadly silent for running and gunning on public land or leave them all year on private. No longer hunting trees during my hunt.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good stand but too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Only reason it’s not a 5 star is because the price. After buying it I wish I could go back and buy 2 hawk stands or buy a hawk stand and steps for the same price as this. I don’t think it’s worth the extra $100. It is a great stand and I like it but value wise there are better options
customer_reviews.author: CGH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Everything i expected. This thing is light enough that I can put it up in the tree with one hand and secure it with the other. It doesn't weigh me down when I'm walking through the woods. Its quiet even when flipping the stool up and down. I modified the back pack straps a bit but thats all personal preference. Even though its expensive I think its worth the money of you are looking for something this light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: BROWN STRAPS SHOWN IN PICTURE DIDN’T COME WITH STAND
customer_reviews.text: Stand was what I expected, good quality, but the reason I went with this stand because it had a unique way of securing it to the tree with the cam buckle straps with the loop at each end. (as shown in picture) I received 0 of those straps, just a basic safety harness, and 2 straps to be used as a lineman belt and a tree tether. After paying this much I now have to buy the straps I expected in the box..... :( also didn’t come with tree cleat so now that’s another thing I have to buy for my 250$ tree stand!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Martin

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate public land stand
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best hang on stand I have ever used. I was stuck between ordering this lone wolf, an XOP, or a millennium. I used a buddies XOP and liked it, but could not get my hands on a millennium to try. After watching some videos reviewing all three, I went out on a limb and ordered the lone wolf. I have no regrets. The versatility is unmatched and I’m more than pleased with the quality. Paired with some hawk helium climbing sticks and there isn’t a tree you can’t hunt from.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie M.

customer_reviews.title: First hang-on1
customer_reviews.text: This is my first hang-on but I have to believe there are more comfortable ones out there. It is light along with being quiet and does also allow you to get in trees a climber cannot. However, for the money I will stick with climbers since along with the stand you need to purchase steps and other accessories to use while in the stand. I realize the steps can be used with multiple hang-ons, but this did not thrill me enough to buy more. Thank you,
customer_reviews.author: Lori H.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: The lightweight stand when combined with the sticks makes a highly mobile setup if you are handy at setup. If you plan to leave up all season you might by a less costly stand to save some money. It is easy to install while standing on the sticks due to the weight though.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great for hang and hunt style hunting
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price. The assault stand is small, and is best for half day sits where you will be carrying your stand/sticks in and out. If you plan to hunt all day, or leave the stand hanging for multiple days, I would recommend the alpha over this. For run and gun/hang and hunt style hunting though, this is definitely the stand to get. Lightweight yet well built and sturdy. Does not squeak or move around while carrying, setting up, or hunting from tree.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Great tree stand but a little rusty out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The tree stand functions and works great! I’ve tested it once so far and seems really nice! The only reason I’m give 4 stars is because when I first opened the box there was rust all over the bolts and hanger/tree stand stuff. I scuffed it up with some steal wool and a dash of paint and I’d say we are back in business! Just thought it was odd for a new product to have so much rust.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Best hang on
customer_reviews.text: I love my hang on! Wish it had cushion around the part to mount your bow so it doesn’t bang your now though. I modified it so it doesn’t scratch my Vertix.
customer_reviews.author: Kou Vue

customer_reviews.title: Rust, Scratches, Was Not New
customer_reviews.text: I will refrain from the explicatives I want to use and keep it on a user friendly scale. I am so disappointed in my purchase. I bought what was described as a “New” tree stand. When the product arrived, as seen in the pictures, rust is on the seat platform and the the base is clearly scuffed. If I wanted a “Used” product I would have clearly purchased an as is product.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Lynn Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the mobile hunter.
customer_reviews.text: This stand is perfect for what I needed. Paired with the hawk helium sticks it is a pretty lightweight mobile setup with a good bit of adjustability for less than perfect trees. Straps are handier than other stands I’ve used and seen pretty solid. Seat is not very comfortable but most hang on stands have pretty small seats. Overall this stand is a workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hollcroft

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and extremely easy setup. Love the straps for securing it. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, good fit on tree. Like the weight and size
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Does what’ it’s supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Love my new mobil stand, already used it a butt load!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick messer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight, and Made in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic stand for a mobil hunter. Light for the size and the cast construction makes it silent and sturdy. I've mounted this in trees as small at 8 inches in diameter and have been able to expand my hunting capability. For those looking for a lightweight mobil hunting platform I highly recommend this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R. Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Missing components
customer_reviews.text: Parts were missing so my husband had me return it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: What else can I say, it’s a lone wolf!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it’s a lone wolf. Best portable hang on stand on the market IMO. This is it if you want super light weight and small for portability. Made the mistake of selling one and then bought another one. Not gonna let that happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: love it for hang and hunt - wrapped edges in paracord for stealth - seat adjust and straps just right highly recommend for hang and hunt
customer_reviews.author: D. Gooch

customer_reviews.title: Check your order though
customer_reviews.text: Missing an important part. The off set teeth on the to of the post . Not good could be a safety issue 😡
customer_reviews.author: marc L.

customer_reviews.title: Best stand ever made I can pick it up with ...
customer_reviews.text: Best stand ever made I can pick it up with my pinky strap it to your backpack or Haul it in one hand easy to use I recommend for everyone, except beginners can be a bit challenging to hang takes a few times getting use to, the best part is you can hang it in almost any tree unlike a climber
customer_reviews.author: Seth clark

customer_reviews.title: Love this tree stand
customer_reviews.text: Love this tree stand. Quiet and easy to put up. It was cheaper than cabelas. Awesome stand! Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim F

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, easy to hang. very Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Would have liked to had the easy hang hook and I didn't get a bumper sticker... :) ha! The stand was everything I expected. Very pleased with it. I was concerned a little that the platform may be a bit to small but no problems there, I was able to move around easily. I managed to take a shot from the seat and that worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R.

customer_reviews.title: Best mobile stand out there
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my hang and hunt. Couldn’t be happier with this. I’ve set it up 3x on a single hunt. Public land dream. Paired with Hawk Helium steps and you’ve got a super light and effective set up. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jt powell

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: 100% recommend for long hauls and quick setups! This came in handy for my Oklahoma trip. Light weight and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie King

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand for Mobile Style Hunting
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased. The stand is ultra quiet to set up and relatively light for carrying. The adjustability for platform and seat leveling is great. I bought better shoulder straps than what was supplied. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David Eubanks

customer_reviews.title: Public land hunters just spend the money and get this stand you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.text: Only had to assemble a couple pieces, so that was nice, already hung it up this spring and was practicing out of it. I can not wait for this season, it will make getting way back in to public land way more doable!
customer_reviews.author: Tylor m

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Like the light weight stand. Has its place in my deer hunting arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: bemccardle

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love how light weight it is. Love how rock solid it sets to the tree. Only drawbacks are that it’s not the most comfortable stand and the plat form is small. Other than that it’s a great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for pack in and pack out
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to. Good for pack in and pack out. It's light but the end extends above your head. Makes for tough mobility in brush.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: For the serious hunter
customer_reviews.text: For the serious hunter. Not cheap. But they are light, sturdy, and a lot less noticeable in the tree. In some areas the deer look up a lot more, they have a lot harder time seeing these stands
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing light weight stand. It's a little low on the comfort factor but you could hunt all day in it and it wouldn't kill you
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Hard seat
customer_reviews.text: Super light and durable.. the seat is kinda hard tho... overall a great stand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid Stand
customer_reviews.text: A very solid stand. Very easy to hang and hunt and the lightweight profile allows you to get in farther and farther every time you hunt. One of the best stands on the market for many reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Julius

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy, simple
customer_reviews.text: My first hang on stand. I really like it. Light, easy to set up, simple.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Whiting

customer_reviews.title: Great for the mobile hunter.
customer_reviews.text: This stand is very light, compact, and easy to travel with through the woods. The only thing I recommend is upgrading the backpack straps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only problem thief’s like them to
customer_reviews.text: Very durable to weather, very quiet no noise During the seating, wind blowing tree moving it’s still quiet.
customer_reviews.author: David Boling

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: Came with out the tree bracket and the straps. The stand was also very scratched up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: Seat is a little uncomfy but otherwise an amazing product. I will never go to anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: I like it very nice to use
customer_reviews.text: I like I used it two very light to carry around
customer_reviews.author: obid Tahir

customer_reviews.title: Hang and hunt
customer_reviews.text: Great stand for hang and hunt. Bought this for public land hunting. This is my 4th Lone Wolf. Love the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Best stand I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like claiming stands. Found this set up and I’m much happier. Primarily used for bow hunting. I am very mobile now.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works very well and its lightweight compared to my other stand
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best stand I own. Have hunted for over 40 years. pricey,but worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Love the lightweight and craftsmanship. Does not make noise when carrying. Great for run n gunnig
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stand did not come with a harness
customer_reviews.text: Stand was perfect however I did not receive a harness with the stand. The box said it contained one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best tree stand out there!
customer_reviews.text: Love the stability and ease of use! And it's super light!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my fiance. He really loves it especially when he sat in it for 7 days and still didn't kill a deer.
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Makes deer hunting a lot easier
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, lightweight, doesn’t move once you strap it to a tree
customer_reviews.author: GolfBoy2.7

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband. He loves it! Much lighter and quieter than his previous stand! He said it is comfortable and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: CJkindle

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for hang and hunt. Cant beat the lightweight for this type of system
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Assault II stand
customer_reviews.text: item is exactly as advertised, will make my hunting excursions much better.
customer_reviews.author: William Ritter

customer_reviews.title: ... lone wolf stands and I️ think they are the best tree stands on the market
customer_reviews.text: I️ have several lone wolf stands and I️ think they are the best tree stands on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Day

customer_reviews.title: Missing items in box - 3 days before hunting season :/
customer_reviews.text: Mine did not come with the tree bracket, or straps. Can I have these supplied to me?
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Frierson

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great Stand!! Hangs fast, very sturdy!! Can’t go wrong for the mobile hunter!!
customer_reviews.author: Huntanfish802

customer_reviews.title: Item not complete.
customer_reviews.text: Mine never came with a harness!! Threw the box away before I realized it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: lone wolf assault II tree stand
customer_reviews.text: awesome stand, sturdy, lightweight, easy set-up and take-down, excellent construction. Delivery was also fast. Read a lot of reviews on stands and this one consistantly stood out as one of the best. Chose this retailer for carrying this stand for a good price, and fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: the cushion is too thin, so it allows the ...
customer_reviews.text: the cushion is too thin, so it allows the riser post to stick out above the cushion. Depending on the angle of your tree and how your posture is you could end up with part of the riser post in your posterior. not pleasant, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C Pace

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with my first stand. The first time hanging it when it was about 100 degrees out was a bit difficult. After getting a little confidence it just gets easier and easier. It is dead silent. Now I just have to work on getting higher. 8 feet feels like 50 feet when I sit down. Hopefully the longer I sit, the higher I can get. The seat could be a bit thicker for all day hunts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stand.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stand.. Had to do a few minor things to make it totally quiet on my way in and out of the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Darion

customer_reviews.title: Great stand. High quality and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great stand . High quality and lightweight. Is the quietest stand I've ever hunted out of.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: By far the best stand I've ever owned. Extremely light quit and solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Stand! When paired with the Lone Wolf climbing sticks it's quick,quiet and mobile!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about the smaller platform, but went with the lower weight rather than the Alpha II. The stand platform is a bit small when seated, but I found it to be plenty big when standing and the seat up. The integrated bow holder works well as long as the stand is hung perfectly, for my Bear Motive 7 anyway. I wouldn't depend on it in all situations. I also bought the easy hook strap, but found this stand so light that I could easily hang it using the climbing sticks and a linemens belt.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tucker

customer_reviews.title: The best stand for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a early present for my fiance and he loves it! I did a lot of searching and read a lot of reviews before settling with this stand. It is super light weight and I bought him the easy strap to go with it, he said it only took a total of five minutes to get up the tree(silently) and hook in to the strap. I highly recommend this stand and it's nice that the easy straps for this we're only $15 which was much cheaper than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the sweetest piece of deer gear I've ever used! GOD BLESS AMERICAN MADE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Lone Wolf Assault II Hang On Tree Stand
product_meta.description: The Assault II Hang On treestand is the leanest of the light weight hang on treestands in the Lone Wolf pack. Weighing in at a mere 11-pounds the Assault's 26" x 19.5" platform provides plenty of room to maneuver, while still promising to fit in the nastiest trees you'll find. The Assault II is the perfect hang-on stand for mobile hunters who want the lightest setup they can get, or for hunters who need to squeeze a stand into tight places.
feature_bullets: The leanest of the light weight hang on treestands in the Lone Wolf pack; Weighs in at a mere 11 pounds
The 26" x 19.5" platform provides plenty of room to maneuver while still able to fit in the nastiest trees you'll find
The perfect hang-on stand for mobile hunters who want the lightest setup they can get, or for hunters who need to squeeze a stand into tight places
In Cast Bow Holder accommodates most parallel limb bows. Backpack straps (optional padded straps available)
350-pound weight limit; Fits trees 4" - 22" in diameter
